task_summary: Detect the T-block and goal mark, approach and align, set end-effector yaw, perform repeated push segments to drive the block into the goal region, verify arrival, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar work surface into a marked goal pose. The robot first perceives both the block and the goal outline, approaches to a safe height, and aligns to the block’s stem. It sets a pushing yaw and executes short push segments, re-detecting as needed to stay on course. The scene contains a single block and a fixed, printed goal mark. Timeouts, discrete tolerances, and limited retries improve robustness at 10 Hz operation.
preconditions: Camera view includes both T-block and goal mark
Workspace is planar and free of obstacles
End-effector is operational and within reach
stepwise_plan: Move above block with small vertical offset.
Approach and align to block within 0.01 m tolerance.
Set TCP yaw to 90 degrees for side pushing.
Execute three 0.1 m push segments toward the goal.
Re-detect block and verify it is at the goal.
Retreat 0.1 m to clear the object.
success_criteria: Block centroid lies within the goal region
Final orientation close enough for the T to visually match the outline
No contact with robot after retreat
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry up to 3 times
If misaligned, re-run approach and alignment before next push
If block stalls, additional push cycles can be issued in future variants
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when IsAt(goal_mark) returns true and retreat finishes; it fails on persistent detection/timeout errors.

frame_3.now_evidence: First solid contact and alignment against the T’s stem is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Initiation of push segments is imminent and direction can be inferred.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Find the T-block in the scene.
Move to a pre-push height above the block.
Close in and align the TCP to the block’s stem.
Orient the tool for lateral pushing.
Short push segment toward the goal.
Verify the block is inside the goal region.
Back off to clear contact after success.

failure_modes: Target or block not detected due to glare/occlusion
Misalignment causing rotation of the T-block
Insufficient push distance due to friction or slip
recovery_strategy: Execute additional push cycles in small increments
assumptions: Colors in frames show a red block and blue outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target. Frames are treated as authoritative.
Exact push direction inferred from frames; 225° chosen as toward the goal region.
10 Hz observation/control is informational; library lacks direct frequency ports.

expected_success_criteria: Centroid of T-block within goal outline and orientation approximately aligned
All actions complete within specified timeouts
